content: *k1 sl 1 pwise wyib repeat from * to end row 4 m knit work these four row eight times or until the blanket measures about 4 5 cm / 1¾ now knit another five row in m for the top of the sheet cast off knitwise sew the two side seams to close the bed the pillow using the long tail method cast on 14 stitches knit two row work the following two row pattern four times 8 row in all row 1 knit row 2 k2 p10 k2 knit three more row cast off knitwise sew the pillow to the bed you can also replace the slip_stitch patterned blanket with 20 row of plain stocking stitch decorating the tin you could paint over the writing on the tin or use paper or stickers … i of course decided to cover it with knitting using the cable method and 2 75 mm needles cast on 18 stitches knit two row next row k2 p14 k2  knit three row next row k2 p14 k2 repeat from  nine more times or until the knitting is nearly long enough to cover the tin lid knit three more row cast off knitwise slipping the first stitch and knitting the last two stitches together button panel using the cable method cast on 11 stitches work 16 row in moss stitch every row k1 *p1 k1 repeat from * to end cast off in pattern add a button and sew to the middle of the knitted lid cover i worked blanket stitch round one of these panels and a running stitch round the edge of the other cover to decorate them a bit more cover the top of the tin with strips of double sided tape and press the knitting down on to it i covered the writing on the bottom of the tin with a paper label covered with library film to make it sturdier the labels i made are included at the end of the pattern one like mine and a blank one for you to add your own message abbreviations st / sts stitch / stitches k knit p purl m1 make 1 by lifting the thread before the next stitch and knitting into the back of it k2tog knit two stitches together p2tog purl two stitches together sl 1 pwise slip one stitch purlwise wyib with yarn held at the back © frankie brown 2013 my patterns are for personal use only and should not be used to knit items for sale please do not use them for teaching purposes without my permission labels for pocket ted pocket ted cut out the double labels fold along the centre line and stick together before attaching to the tin © frankie brown 2013
